main event: A bright white light moving horizontally and vertically was observed in Norwalk, Ohio on December 1, 1963.
interesting points: The light resembled a car headlight but was too far away to be identified clearly., The object moved at a high rate of speed before disappearing., The observation lasted for about 20 minutes., The observer could not definitively identify the object as a vehicle., Initial conclusion suggested that the light could be identified as Venus.
